page.title: 11Eaglesfield Bantam Show
page.content: The bantam show held annually in the village is the continuation of a 21 year old{custom,}previous to that there was a show in Lockerbie. People, mostly men bring their pedigree bantams, poultry and pigeons to be judged. This year there were 66 classes for varieties of{poultry}and bantams and another ten for pigeons, including the only classes for fancy pigeons in this Region. In the past when nearly every household kept poultry in the back yard it was mainly local people who showed. Now people come from as far away as Girvan and Kelso. They belong to their local poultry{clubs}and get {entertainment}from trying to breed and show a champion bird. For some years interest waned as cost of feedstuff increased, but now more young lads are becoming involved.
